references.paper_title: ScanNet: Richly-Annotated 3D Reconstructions of Indoor Scenes
references.reason: This paper introduces ScanNet, a widely used and influential benchmark dataset for indoor 3D scene understanding.  Its rich annotations and the scale of the dataset make it a crucial reference point for evaluating the performance of 3D semantic segmentation models.  The paper's contribution to the field significantly impacts the development and evaluation of new techniques in 3D scene understanding.

references.paper_title: ScanNet: Richly-Annotated 3D Reconstructions of Indoor Scenes
references.reason: ScanNet serves as a primary benchmark for evaluating 3D semantic segmentation models.  Its extensive dataset and detailed annotations make it a critical reference for assessing the performance of new models and datasets, influencing the research direction and providing a common evaluation standard in the field.

references.paper_title: 3D Semantic Parsing of Large-Scale Indoor Spaces
references.reason: This paper presents S3DIS, a dataset used for 3D semantic segmentation that includes 6 large-scale indoor areas with 271 rooms. This dataset is significant for providing real-world data and its large scale, even though it lacks dense annotations, making it a relevant comparison for new approaches to 3D scene understanding.

references.paper_title: Point-wise Convolutional Neural Network
references.reason: This work contributes to the body of knowledge on point-based methods in 3D semantic segmentation, a significant category of models compared to voxel-based or transformer-based methods. Understanding point-based methods and their characteristics is essential when developing new 3D segmentation techniques.

references.paper_title: 4D Spatio-Temporal ConvNets: Minkowski Convolutional Neural Networks
references.reason: This publication introduces MinkowskiNet, a prominent voxel-based model frequently used as a baseline and comparison point in 3D semantic segmentation research.  The architecture's widespread use makes it a key reference for assessing the performance of new models and techniques.

references.paper_title: 4D Spatio-Temporal ConvNets: Minkowski Convolutional Neural Networks
references.reason: MinkowskiNet is a widely adopted baseline model in 3D semantic segmentation and thus, evaluating its performance on the newly introduced dataset in comparison to other models is essential.  The architecture's significance is highlighted by its frequent use in the literature.

references.paper_title: KPConv: Flexible and Deformable Convolution for Point Clouds
references.reason: This paper presents KPConv, a significant contribution to point-based 3D semantic segmentation models. Its flexibility and deformability enhance the performance of point cloud processing and are relevant to the advancements made in 3D scene understanding.  Understanding and comparing this architecture with other methods such as transformer-based architectures is important for evaluating the effectiveness of the new dataset.

references.paper_title: PointNet: Deep Learning on Point Sets for 3D Classification and Segmentation
references.reason: PointNet is a seminal work in deep learning for point cloud processing, which introduced novel approaches for directly processing point clouds without relying on voxelization or other intermediate representations.  PointNet's influence on the field is substantial, shaping many subsequent developments in 3D scene understanding.   Comparing to PointNet is crucial for evaluating the dataset and methods presented.

references.paper_title: PointNet++: Deep Hierarchical Feature Learning on Point Sets in a Metric Space
references.reason: PointNet++ builds upon PointNet, addressing its limitations by incorporating hierarchical feature learning. This improvement significantly impacts the performance of point cloud processing and is a relevant development in the field.  Its architecture and performance benchmarks are crucial for comparison and evaluation of new methods.

references.paper_title: Arkitscenes: A diverse real-world dataset for 3d indoor scene understanding using mobile rgb-d data
references.reason: This paper introduces ARKitScenes, the largest existing real-world dataset of indoor scenes.  While it lacks the dense annotations necessary for advanced model training, its size and diversity in capturing real-world scenes make it a relevant base for building upon. The dataset's limitations in terms of annotations form a significant motivation for this paper.

references.paper_title: Arkitscenes: A diverse real-world dataset for 3d indoor scene understanding using mobile rgb-d data
references.reason: ARKitScenes serves as the foundation for this paper. The paper utilizes this large dataset to evaluate the proposed LabelMaker pipeline's capabilities in generating large-scale, densely annotated datasets for 3D semantic segmentation.  The success of the pipeline in processing ARKitScenes demonstrates its scalability and efficiency.

references.paper_title: Mix3D: Out-of-Context Data Augmentation for 3D Scenes
references.reason: Mix3D is used in the paper's results section for comparing the dataset's contribution to the results for 3D semantic segmentation models.   The methodology used in Mix3D's approach directly impacts the evaluation of the dataset.  The proposed method improves upon Mix3D's performance by using the ARKit LabelMaker dataset, highlighting the significance of high-quality data.

references.paper_title: Point Transformer v2: Grouped vector attention and partition-based pooling
references.reason: Point Transformer v2 is a critical reference as it builds upon earlier transformer-based architectures for 3D point cloud processing. The advancements made in Point Transformer v2 are essential in the context of evaluating the proposed method for generating dense semantic annotations for 3D scene understanding.

references.paper_title: Segment Anything
references.reason: The integration of SAM, a state-of-the-art 2D segmentation model, is a key improvement in this paper's proposed pipeline. SAM's capabilities in generating high-quality segmentation masks significantly improve the annotation accuracy and generalization of the LabelMaker pipeline, making it a central aspect of the work.

references.paper_title: Grounding Dino: Marrying Dino with grounded pre-training for open-set object detection
references.reason: The integration of Grounding DINO, in combination with SAM, is another key improvement in this paper's pipeline. Grounding DINO's ability to locate instances’ bounding boxes given semantic labels or natural languages significantly improves the accuracy and robustness of the automatic annotation process. The use of this method makes this paper a notable reference.

references.paper_title: Language-Grounded Indoor 3D Semantic Segmentation in the Wild
references.reason: This paper introduces ScanNet200, a dataset used in this paper's results section for evaluating the performance of 3D semantic segmentation. The dataset is significant for providing annotations with many more classes than the original ScanNet dataset, which enables more detailed evaluation of models' capabilities for capturing finer-grained semantic information.

references.paper_title: Language-Grounded Indoor 3D Semantic Segmentation in the Wild
references.reason: ScanNet200 serves as a benchmark dataset for evaluating 3D semantic segmentation performance.  Its increased number of classes compared to the original ScanNet dataset allows for more detailed performance evaluation. The paper’s results compare the proposed method’s performance on ScanNet200 against established baselines.

references.paper_title: Point Transformer v3: Simpler, faster, stronger
references.reason: Point Transformer v3, along with Point Prompt Training, is a state-of-the-art model for 3D semantic segmentation that is used in this paper for comparison.  Its performance on various benchmarks serves as a standard for evaluating the improvements offered by the dataset and methodology proposed in this research.

references.paper_title: LabelMaker: Automatic Semantic Label Generation from RGB-D Trajectories
references.reason: This paper introduces the LabelMaker pipeline, which forms the foundation of this paper's approach.  LabelMaker's automatic annotation pipeline is extended in this work to handle the large-scale ARKitScenes dataset, highlighting the importance of this previous work in creating the new dataset presented.

references.paper_title: LabelMaker: Automatic Semantic Label Generation from RGB-D Trajectories
references.reason: The core methodology in this paper is based on extending the LabelMaker pipeline.  Therefore, understanding the original pipeline and its capabilities is crucial for evaluating the improvements and advancements presented in this work. The previous work's approach forms the base for this paper's novel contributions.
